title: Adds elderly persons to disaster preparedness registries and creates a state emergency assistance database
summary: Adds elderly persons to disaster preparedness registries and creates a state emergency assistance database; provides that the disaster preparedness commission shall establish the state emergency assistance database, all records relating to SEAD shall be confidential and the commission shall not be liable for any claim based upon a good faith exercise or performance of duty.

       AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to adding elderly persons
         to disaster preparedness registries and  creating  a  state  emergency
         assistance database

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The section heading and subdivisions  1,  2,  3  and  4  of
    2  section  23-a  of the executive law, as added by chapter 658 of the laws
    3  of 1996, are amended to read as follows:
    4    County registry of ELDERLY OR disabled persons; notice.  1.   In  each
    5  county  having  a  local  disaster preparedness plan pursuant to section
    6  twenty-three of this article, in order to  meet  the  special  needs  of
    7  persons  who would need assistance during evacuations OR OTHER EMERGENCY
    8  SITUATIONS and sheltering because of physical or mental  handicaps,  [it
    9  is  recommended  that] OR WHOSE ABILITY TO CARE FOR THEMSELVES DURING AN
   10  EMERGENCY SITUATION IS ADVERSELY AFFECTED BY ADVANCED AGE, OR  PERMANENT
   11  OR  TEMPORARY  MEDICAL  CONDITION, each chief executive SHALL maintain a
   12  registry of ELDERLY OR disabled persons located within the county.   The
   13  registration shall identify those persons in need of assistance and plan
   14  for  resource  allocation to meet those identified needs.  To assist the
   15  chief executive in identifying such persons, the  county  department  of
   16  health,  or  such other county department or agency as designated by the
   17  chief executive, shall provide voluntary registration information to all
   18  of its special needs clients and to all incoming clients as part of  the
   19  intake  process.    The registry shall be updated annually AT A MINIMUM.
   20  The registration program shall give  ELDERLY  OR  disabled  persons  the
   21  option  of  pre-authorizing  emergency response personnel to enter their
   22  homes during search and rescue operations if necessary to  assure  their
   23  safety and welfare during disasters.
   24    2.  Upon the establishment of a voluntary registry of ELDERLY OR disa-
   25  bled persons as provided in subdivision one of this section,  the  chief
   26  executive  shall make such registry available to the appropriate county,
   27  state and federal agencies for their use in delivering services  in  the

    1  event of a local or state disaster. The chief executive shall[, upon the
    2  request of the state emergency management office,] provide such registry
    3  information  to  [such  office]  THE  STATE EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT OFFICE,
    4  INCLUDING ALL ANNUAL UPDATES TO SUCH REGISTRY INFORMATION, FOR PLACEMENT

    7  preparedness  only  in coordination with other political subdivisions of
    8  the state.
    9    3.  Upon the establishment of a voluntary registry of ELDERLY OR disa-
   10  bled persons as provided in subdivision one of this  section,  at  least
   11  semi-annually,  each  chief  executive  shall cause to be published in a
   12  newspaper of general circulation within  the  county  a  notice  of  the
   13  availability of the voluntary registration program.
   14    4.  All  records, data, information, correspondence and communications
   15  relating to the registration of ELDERLY OR disabled persons as  provided
   16  in  subdivision  one  of this section are confidential, except that such
   17  information shall be available to  other  county  chief  executives  for
   18  local  disaster  preparedness  only as the chief executive of the county
   19  maintaining such registry deems necessary. Provided, however, the  indi-
   20  vidual  file of a person having registered with the registry of disabled
   21  persons shall be made available to that person upon request.
   22    S 2. Section 23-a of the executive law is  amended  by  adding  a  new
   23  subdivision 7 to read as follows:
   24    7.  (A)  THE COMMISSION SHALL ESTABLISH THE STATE EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE
   25  DATABASE (SEAD). THE SEAD  SHALL  BE  A  COMPREHENSIVE  LISTING  OF  ALL
   26  PERSONS  LOCATED  IN THE STATE, WHO HAVE VOLUNTARILY REQUESTED PLACEMENT
   27  ON ANY COUNTY REGISTRY OF ELDERLY OR  DISABLED  PERSONS  AS  ESTABLISHED
   28  PURSUANT  TO THIS SECTION, AND IN ADDITION SHALL ACCEPT VOLUNTARY REGIS-
   29  TRANTS DIRECTLY AS NEEDED, AT WHICH TIME SUCH  REGISTRATION  INFORMATION
   30  COLLECTED SHALL BE FORWARDED TO THE APPROPRIATE COUNTY REGISTRY.
   31    (B)  THE  SEAD  SHALL BE MADE ACCESSIBLE TO ALL SUCH APPROPRIATE STATE
   32  AND COUNTY EMERGENCY RESPONSE PERSONNEL  AND  ORGANIZATIONS  AS  MAY  BE
   33  DEEMED  APPROPRIATE  BY  THE  COMMISSION  IN  ORDER TO PROPERLY PLAN FOR
   34  SECURING THE NEEDS, SAFETY, AND  WELL-BEING  OF  THE  REGISTRANTS.  THIS
   35  SHALL  INCLUDE, BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO, PLANNING FOR EVACUATIONS, ASSESS-
   36  ING THE NEED FOR INDIVIDUAL EVACUATIONS DURING EMERGENCY SITUATIONS THAT
   37  MAY NOT REQUIRE THE EVACUATION OF  THE  GENERAL  PUBLIC,  PREPOSITIONING
   38  EQUIPMENT  AND  SUPPLIES, OR SUCH OTHER MEASURES AS THE COMMISSION DEEMS
   39  NECESSARY TO ACCOMPLISH THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS ARTICLE. IN ADDITION, THE
   40  SEAD SHALL BE MADE  ACCESSIBLE  TO  ALL  APPROPRIATE  FEDERAL  EMERGENCY
   41  RESPONSE  ORGANIZATIONS AND SHALL BE MADE AVAILABLE TO SUCH OTHER VOLUN-
   42  TARY RELIEF ORGANIZATIONS AS THE COMMISSION DEEMS NECESSARY.
   43    (C) ALL RECORDS, DATA, INFORMATION, CORRESPONDENCE AND  COMMUNICATIONS
   44  RELATING TO THE SEAD SHALL BE CONFIDENTIAL, EXCEPT THAT SUCH INFORMATION
   45  MAY BE MADE AVAILABLE AT THE DISCRETION OF THE COMMISSION IN FURTHERANCE
   46  OF  THE  OBJECTIVES  OF  THIS  ARTICLE.  THE INDIVIDUAL FILE OF A PERSON
   47  HAVING REGISTERED WITH THE SEAD SHALL BE MADE AVAILABLE TO  THAT  PERSON
   48  UPON REQUEST.
   49    (D)  THE  COMMISSION  SHALL NOT BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM BASED UPON THE
   50  GOOD FAITH EXERCISE OR PERFORMANCE OR THE GOOD FAITH FAILURE TO EXERCISE
   51  OR PERFORM A FUNCTION OR DUTY ON THE PART OF ANY OFFICER OR EMPLOYEE  IN
   52  THE MAINTENANCE OR USAGE OF THE SEAD.
   53    S 3. This act shall take effect immediately.
